intro: Phyllanthus kozhikodianus, commonly known as Kozhikodianus leaf or Kozhikodianus plant, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in dense undergrowth. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The species is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique morphology and potential medicinal properties.
